Good man!
Bodhisattvas in their last life attain such innumerable liberation gates that cannot be spoken of.
Sudhana said:
Sage!

Maitreya said:
To where they came from.
He said:
Where did they come from?
He said:
They came from the wisdom and spiritual power of the bodhisattvas and abide in the wisdom and spiritual power of the bodhisattvas;
There is not the slightest place of coming or going;
There is no accumulation, no increase, no formation, no establishment, not relying on the earth, not relying on the sky, and being far removed from everything.
Good man!
It is like the dragon king's various clouds and rains, which do not come from the body, do not come from the mind, and have no accumulation, establishment, or increase;
But by the power of the dragon king's mental resolve, a great downpour spreads throughout the world;
this is the inconceivable realm of the dragon king.
Good man!
Those adornments are also like this;
they do not abide within or without;
but it is due to the bodhisattva's majestic virtue and freedom, and your power of good roots, that you do not see them.

It is like a magician creating various illusions, coming from nowhere and going nowhere, with no activity, no entry, no concealment, and no manifestation, yet clearly appearing through the power of illusion. Those adornments are also like this;

coming from nowhere and going nowhere, with no accumulation and no accomplishment, yet manifesting like this due to the power of the inconceivable illusory wisdom cultivated in the past and the power of past great vows.
The youth Sudhana said:
Great Sage!
Where did you come from?
Maitreya said:
Good man!
All bodhisattvas come without coming and going;
They come without practice or abiding;

Without dwelling, without certainty, without sinking, without birth, without abiding, without change, without movement, without arising, without attachment, without action, without retribution, without arising, without cessation, without annihilation, and without permanence - they come like this.
Furthermore, good man!
Bodhisattvas come from the place of great compassion, because they pity and tame all beings;
They come from the place of great kindness, because they rescue and protect beings suffering from oppression;
They come from the place of pure precepts, because they are born freely according to their wishes;
They come from the place of great vows, because they are empowered by their past vows;
They come from the place of spiritual powers, because they manifest freely in all places;
coming from the place of imperturbability, not abandoning the TathÄgata's imperturbable essence;
coming from the place of non-grasping and non-rejection, not causing body and mind to come and go;
coming from the place of wisdom and skillful means, in accordance with all sentient beings;
coming from the place of manifesting transformations, like a reflection appearing in a mirror.
Moreover, good man!
As for your question about where I have come from, good man!
I have come here from the village of houses in the country of Malada, my birthplace;

there is an elder named Gautama, in order to transform him and cause him to enter the Buddha's teachings, and also for the sake of the people in my birthplace, teaching the Dharma according to their capacities;
I also expound the MahÄyÄna for my parents, relatives, family members, and brahmins, causing them to enter it, therefore I dwell there and have come from there.ğŸ”½Sudhana said:
Noble one!
What is the place of birth for bodhisattvas?
Maitreya replied,
Good man!
Bodhisattvas have ten kinds of places of birth;
What are the ten?
They are:
Arousing the mind of enlightenment is the place of birth for bodhisattvas, because they are born into the family of bodhisattvas;
The profound mind is the place of birth for bodhisattvas, because they are born into the family of good and virtuous friends;
The various stages are the place of birth for bodhisattvas, because they are born into the family of the perfections;
Great vows are the place of birth for bodhisattvas, because they are born into the family of wondrous practices;
Great compassion is the place of birth for bodhisattvas, because they are born into the family of the four means of conversion;
Reasoned contemplation is the place of birth for bodhisattvas, because they are born into the family of the perfection of wisdom;
The Great Vehicle is the place of birth for bodhisattvas, because they are born into the family of skillful means;
Maturing sentient beings is the place of birth for bodhisattvas, because they are born into the family of equal and correct enlightenment;
Wisdom and skillful means are the place of birth for bodhisattvas, because they are born into the family of the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas;
Cultivating all dharmas is the place of birth for bodhisattvas, because they are born into the family of all tathÄgatas of the three times.
Good sons!
These are the ten places of birth for bodhisattvas.
Furthermore, good sons!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas take prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ as their mother and skillful means as their father,

The bodhisattva thus transcends the stage of ordinary beings and enters the stage of the bodhisattva;
born in the TathÄgata's family, abiding in the Buddha's lineage;
able to cultivate all practices, not cutting off the Three Jewels;
skillfully protecting the bodhisattva lineage, purifying the bodhisattva lineage;

Because they understand all dharmas to be like reflections, they have no contempt for places of birth in the world;

Equally all sentient beings' different forms, equally all sentient beings' various languages, equally all sentient beings' various names, equally all sentient beings' various desires, equally all sentient beings' various deportments in accordance with worldly teachings to transform and subdue, equally able to manifest all sentient beings' pure rebirth, equally able to enter in accordance with all sentient beings' profound aspirations, equally all bodhisattvas' great vows and transformations, manifesting bodies in such immeasurable categories, with various appearances and various majestic virtues filling the Dharma realm.

At that time, the youth Sudhana addressed MaÃ±juÅ›rÄ« Bodhisattva, saying:
Sage!
How does one attain the sage's skillful means in regard to lands?

Good man!

All bodhisattvas, in order to realize the ultimate truth, abandon great wealth, youth, and kingship, and are able to practice various austerities that are difficult to practice. Sage!

Furthermore, good man!
The bodhisattva has ten kinds of dharmas, fully and completely, and then attains an equal mind towards sentient beings.
What are the ten?
First, being equal in what is done for all sentient beings;
Second, the mind being unobstructed towards all sentient beings;
Third, the mind being without weariness towards all sentient beings;

Fifth, gathering all wisdom for all sentient beings, yet not relying on the characteristics of non-duality;

It is like a householder in the world who gives birth to five children. He loves them equally and provides them with necessities without discrimination;

If bodhisattvas perfect these ten dharmas, they will be able to accomplish making offerings to the TathÄgatas;
Not with wealth, treasures, food and drink, or clothing is it called true offerings.
Why is it so?
The TathÄgata respects and reveres the Dharma,
Just like a filial child who respects and reveres his parents, following their wishes without ever abandoning them for a moment;
If there are people who respect their parents, their children will doubly respect those people;
The Buddhas, the TathÄgatas, are also like this;
If sentient beings make offerings to the Dharma, they truly accomplish making offerings to the TathÄgatas, because the TathÄgatas respect and revere the Dharma.
